name: Conditions
content:
Characters in Renaissance are more than their stats. The adventuring life takes a toll, and emotions can run high. CONDITIONS bring that into the game.

Conditions & Skill Checks

While each column of skills on your character sheet is derived from one of the core stats, each row of skills has an associated condition.

Each condition represents a heightened emotional state that has a negative effect on a character's performance, in the form of a -1d penalty to all skill checks in that row:

  • INSECURE inhibits Awe, Perform and Persuade, as your confidence is diminished.

  • GUILTY inhibits Strength, Insight and Awareness, as your shame turns your focus inward.

  • ANGRY inhibits Dexterity, Courtesy and Stealth, as your rage prevents you from being careful.

  • AFRAID inhibits Fortitude, Spirit and Lore, as your fear diminishes your inner strength.

  • TROUBLED inhibits Craft, Aid and Riddle, as you are preoccupied with your thoughts.

Characters gain conditions as the result of various effects in the game, including combat. An effect will never specify which condition a player must check; It is always up to the player which condition they choose to check, according to how they feel their character would react to what’s happening to them.

In addition to their mechanical effects, conditions also serve as a roleplaying prompt for how your character is reacting to the pressures of a given situation. This is particularly the case with regard to clearing conditions:

Clearing Conditions

While there are many abilities and effects that may allow a character to clear a condition, each condition can also be cleared through narrative character choices:

  • To clear INSECURE, take foolhardy action without consulting your companions.

  • To clear GUILTY, make a personal sacrifice to absolve yourself.

  • To clear ANGRY, break something important or lash out at a friend.

  • To clear AFRAID, run from danger or difficulty.

  • To clear TROUBLED, seek guidance from someone whose advice has meaning to you.

The GM has discretion to determine whether a character’s actions meet the requirements for clearing a condition through narrative action.

If a player wants to take action to clear a condition and gain the mechanical benefits while keeping their actions a secret, they may inform the GM and gain their approval in private.

BOUTS OF MADNESS

When a character checks all 5 conditions, they suffer a BOUT OF MADNESS: they lose control for a short time and do something they will later regret. The player dictates the character’s actions and the GM takes a Hard Move resulting from the action. The player and GM should work together to craft a significant moment in the story of the character.

When the bout of madness passes, the character clears all conditions.
